edu.umass.cs.gnsserver.gnsapp.clientCommandProcessor.commandSupport

Enum UpdateOperation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<UpdateOperation>
      • edu.umass.cs.gnsserver.gnsapp.clientCommandProcessor.commandSupport.UpdateOperation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<UpdateOperation>

    public enum UpdateOperation
extends Enum<UpdateOperation>
    Defines a variety of update operations that can be performed on a field. There are two formats supported for fields. A JSONObject based format and the older JSONArray format. In general you don't want to mix the two, but in some cases you can use both together.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      CREATE_INDEX
      Updates the value of field using the JSON Object.
      SINGLE_FIELD_APPEND
      Appends the given value onto the current values TREATING THE LIST AS A SET - meaning no duplicates.
      SINGLE_FIELD_APPEND_OR_CREATE
      An upsert operation similar to SINGLE_FIELD_APPEND that creates the field if it does not exist.
      SINGLE_FIELD_APPEND_WITH_DUPLICATION
      Appends the given value onto the current values TREATING THE LIST AS A LIST - duplicates are not removed.
      SINGLE_FIELD_CLEAR
      Deletes all the values from the field.
      SINGLE_FIELD_CREATE
      Creates the field with the given value.
      SINGLE_FIELD_REMOVE
      Deletes the values from the current values.
      SINGLE_FIELD_REMOVE_FIELD
      Slightly different than the rest in that it actually removes the field.
      SINGLE_FIELD_REPLACE_ALL
      Replaces the current values with this list.
      SINGLE_FIELD_REPLACE_ALL_OR_CREATE
      An upsert operation similar to SINGLE_FIELD_REPLACE_ALL that creates the field if it does not exist.
      SINGLE_FIELD_REPLACE_SINGLETON
      Treats the value as a singleton and replaces the current value with this one.
      SINGLE_FIELD_SET
      Sets the element of the list specified by the argument index.
      SINGLE_FIELD_SET_FIELD_NULL
      Sets the field to null (a singleton).
      SINGLE_FIELD_SUBSTITUTE
      Replaces all instances of the old value with the new value - if old and new are lists does a pairwise replacement.
      USER_JSON_REPLACE
      Updates the value of field using the JSON Object.
      USER_JSON_REPLACE_OR_CREATE
      Updates the value of field using the JSON Object creating the field if it does not exist.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      UpdateOperation getNonUpsertEquivalent()
      Returns the operation similar to an upsert operation that is not an upsert operation.
      boolean isAbleToSkipRead()
      Indicates that this operation can proceed without having to first read the record from the database.
      boolean isSingleFieldOperation()
      Indicates that this operation only operates on a single field (key/value) in the given record.
      boolean isUpsert()
      Indicates that this operation will attempt to create a field that does not already exist.

      Updates a valuesMap object based on the parameters given.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • USER_JSON_REPLACE

        public static final UpdateOperation USER_JSON_REPLACE
        Updates the value of field using the JSON Object. Fields already in the record not in the JSON Object are not touched.

      • USER_JSON_REPLACE_OR_CREATE

        public static final UpdateOperation USER_JSON_REPLACE_OR_CREATE
        Updates the value of field using the JSON Object creating the field if it does not exist. Fields already in the record not in the JSON Object are not touched.

      • CREATE_INDEX

        public static final UpdateOperation CREATE_INDEX
        Updates the value of field using the JSON Object. Fields already in the record not in the JSON Object are not touched.

      • SINGLE_FIELD_CREATE

        public static final UpdateOperation SINGLE_FIELD_CREATE
        Creates the field with the given value.

      • SINGLE_FIELD_REMOVE_FIELD

        public static final UpdateOperation SINGLE_FIELD_REMOVE_FIELD
        Slightly different than the rest in that it actually removes the field.

      • SINGLE_FIELD_CLEAR

        Deletes all the values from the field.

      • SINGLE_FIELD_REPLACE_ALL

        public static final UpdateOperation SINGLE_FIELD_REPLACE_ALL

      • SINGLE_FIELD_REMOVE

        public static final UpdateOperation SINGLE_FIELD_REMOVE
        Deletes the values from the current values.

      • SINGLE_FIELD_REPLACE_SINGLETON

        public static final UpdateOperation SINGLE_FIELD_REPLACE_SINGLETON
        Treats the value as a singleton and replaces the current value with this one.

      • SINGLE_FIELD_APPEND

        public static final UpdateOperation SINGLE_FIELD_APPEND
        Appends the given value onto the current values TREATING THE LIST AS A SET - meaning no duplicates.

      • SINGLE_FIELD_APPEND_OR_CREATE

        public static final UpdateOperation SINGLE_FIELD_APPEND_OR_CREATE
        An upsert operation similar to SINGLE_FIELD_APPEND that creates the field if it does not exist.

      • SINGLE_FIELD_REPLACE_ALL_OR_CREATE

        public static final UpdateOperation SINGLE_FIELD_REPLACE_ALL_OR_CREATE
        An upsert operation similar to SINGLE_FIELD_REPLACE_ALL that creates the field if it does not exist.

      • SINGLE_FIELD_APPEND_WITH_DUPLICATION

        public static final UpdateOperation SINGLE_FIELD_APPEND_WITH_DUPLICATION
        Appends the given value onto the current values TREATING THE LIST AS A LIST - duplicates are not removed.

      • SINGLE_FIELD_SUBSTITUTE

        public static final UpdateOperation SINGLE_FIELD_SUBSTITUTE
        Replaces all instances of the old value with the new value - if old and new are lists does a pairwise replacement.

        Sets the element of the list specified by the argument index.

      • isSingleFieldOperation

        public boolean isSingleFieldOperation()
        Indicates that this operation only operates on a single field (key/value) in the given record.
        Returns:
        a boolean

      • isAbleToSkipRead

        public boolean isAbleToSkipRead()
        Indicates that this operation can proceed without having to first read the record from the database. In other words, whatever this operation does it ignores the current contents of the database - say maybe something like am "overwrite all the contents of the given field" operation.
        Returns:
        a boolean

      • isUpsert

        public boolean isUpsert()
        Indicates that this operation will attempt to create a field that does not already exist.
        Returns:
        a boolean if this is an upsert operation

      • getNonUpsertEquivalent

        public UpdateOperation getNonUpsertEquivalent()
        Returns the operation similar to an upsert operation that is not an upsert operation.
        Returns:
        the equivalent non-upsert operation

      • updateValuesMap

        public static boolean updateValuesMap(ValuesMap valuesMap,
                                      String key,
                                      ResultValue newValues,
                                      ResultValue oldValues,
                                      int argument,
                                      ValuesMap userJSON,
                                      UpdateOperation operation)
        Updates a valuesMap object based on the parameters given. If the key doesn't exist this will create it, but NameRecord code that calls this should still check for the key existing in the name record so that the client can depend on that behavior for certain operations.
        Parameters:
        valuesMap -
        key -
        newValues -
        oldValues -
        argument -
        userJSON - - mutually exclusive of newValues, oldValues and argument (and only for non-SingleFieldOperations)
        operation -
        Returns:
        false if the value was not updated true otherwise
